p: The Area Under the Receiver Operating Curve (AUC-ROC) is the most common metric to evaluate the accuracy of models [ 79]. AUC values â‰¤ 0.5 indicate that the model failed to perform better than random expectations, whereas values close to 1 indicate a good performance of the model [ 80]. In practice, the AUC-ROC is calculated based on a series of trapezoids [ 81], with the curve essentially "connecting the points" representing the different thresholds of the prediction [ 82]. This approach is used when input data is partitioned, in this case into training and test data [ 83]. When biotic data are divided into presence and absence (background), the AUC measures the discriminatory ability of the model to correctly predict the origin of these data if randomly selected [ 51].
